body: I guess huge part of the problem I'm facing is that I'm looking for something that **does not** happen, and I'm not even sure where it's supposed to be happening.
Do you have any sort of failing test?
I mean, in Psalm's own repo

Not in Psalm repo, no. But I can reproduce it in doctrine-psalm-plugin repo:

```console
git clone git@github.com:weirdan/doctrine-psalm-plugin.git
cd doctrine-psalm-plugin
git checkout allow-psalm-4
composer install
vendor/bin/codecept run acceptance tests/acceptance/EntityManager.feature:'Getting a reference'
```
After it runs (and fails) there will be `tests/_run` folder left behind, which contains a PHP file and `psalm.xml` file - running `../../vendor/bin/psalm` inside that folder will reproduce the issue. Note that you would need to run Psalm from the vendor folder - otherwise the plugin wouldn't load.

Sorry if that looks overly complicated, but that's the only way I'm able to reproduce the issue.

I did, it doesn't produce the same effect (i.e. it reports `I|null` as opposed to what I'm getting in the plugin repo). Below is what I tried:

```diff
diff --git a/tests/StubTest.php b/tests/StubTest.php
index 1a0fecd9e..fd8f7e3da 100644
--- a/tests/StubTest.php
+++ b/tests/StubTest.php
@@ -1178,4 +1178,41 @@ public function testStubOverridingMissingMethod(): void
 
         $this->analyzeFile($file_path, new Context());
     }
+
+    public function testStubImplementingStubDoesNotLeakTemplate(): void
+    {
+        $this->project_analyzer = $this->getProjectAnalyzerWithConfig(
+            TestConfig::loadFromXML(
+                dirname(__DIR__),
+                '<?xml version="1.0"?>
+                <psalm>
+                    <projectFiles>
+                        <directory name="src" />
+                    </projectFiles>
+                    <stubs>
+                        <file name="/home/weirdan/src/psalm/plugins/doctrine-psalm-plugin/stubs/EntityManagerInterface.phpstub" />
+                        <file name="/home/weirdan/src/psalm/plugins/doctrine-psalm-plugin/stubs/EntityManager.phpstub" />
+                        <file name="/home/weirdan/src/psalm/plugins/doctrine-psalm-plugin/stubs/ObjectManager.phpstub" />
+                    </stubs>
+                </psalm>'
+            )
+        );
+
+        $file_path = getcwd() . '/src/somefile.php';
+
+        $this->addFile(
+            $file_path,
+            '<?php
+                  use Doctrine\ORM\EntityManager;
+                  interface I {}
+                  /**
+                   * @psalm-suppress InvalidReturnType
+                   * @return EntityManager
+                   */
+                  function em() {}
+                  atan(em()->getReference(I::class, 1));
+            '
+        );
+        $this->analyzeFile($file_path, new Context());
+    }
 }
```
Also tried to put the stubs in `tests/fixtures/stubs/`, that produces exactly the same effect.
Ok, I'm getting closer - the key thing to reproduce it is to have actual `EntityManagerInterface` in the vendor folder.

issue.title: Reproducer for vimeo/psalm#4705

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body: I believe I finally managed to reproduce #4705 in Psalm codebase. The issue now should show up in CI builds.

body: @muglug I've finally managed to reproduce it, please see linked PR.

Psalm sets a `ClassLikeStorage::$documenting_method_ids` variable to point to the method with param and return types. This was set one way during the initial scan (because of the implicit inheritdoc from the class to the interface) but when scanning with stubs it should be emptied out, as its no longer valid (here the class provides its own params and return types).
